_header: That good thinketh good may do
Title(s): The Castle of Love ; Chateau d’Amour
_description: The Castle of Love, a translation of Grosseteste’s Chateau d’Amour — 1860 lines in couplets

BodAddB107.First Lines:
He þat good þenkeþ good may doAnd god will helpen
                    him þer toffor þer was neuer good werk I wrowghtWiþ
                    oute be gynnynge of good thowght…
BodAddB107.Last Lines:
…How myȝht he þen for eny þowgtOf goddis
                    feyrenes þenkyn owght…
BodAddB107.Note:
On f. 37 includes the story of the 15 tokens before Doomsday beginning
                    with: ‘Lvsteneþ ȝet forþer of ysayes spelle / ffor now
                    ȝe han herd me telle / How swete Ihesu our fadur was / Herkenyth how he is
                    now prince of pes…’; but Ends imperfectly due to the loss of
                    folios.
BodAddB107.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard. 
             The Castle of Love.
         Brixton Hill, 1849: 1-80.
Sajavaara,  K.,
                        ed.  
             The Middle English Translations of Robert Grosseteste’s Chateau
                d’Amour.
Mémoires de la Société Néophilologique de
                Helsinki
         32. Helsinki, 1967: 260.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
ÞAt good þenkeþ good may doAnd God wol helpe him
                    þer to…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…God leeue vs here to endeÞat we ben worþi to heuene
                    wende Amen.
